question.text:
Find out the pairs, which are CORRECTLY matched?
 
A. Cyanobacteria 1. Biopesticides
B. Mycorrhiza 2. Solubilization of phosphate
C. Bacillus thuringiensis 3. Single-cell protein
D. Chlorella 4. Biofertilizer

solution.text:
Cyanobacteria is a photosynthetic-bacteria which forms symbiotic relationship with plants and fixes nitrogen. It is useful as biofertilizer.

Bacillus thuringensis is a bacteria having the capacity to produce an insecticidal protein called bt toxin. It has application as bioinsecticide/biopesticide.

Mycorrhizae is a mutual relationship between fungi and plant. Both benefit from each other. In it, the fungus colonises the root system of the host plant either intra- or extra- cellularly. The fungal group is known to absorb phosphorus from soil and pass it to the host plant.

Microbes are used a direct source of food as they are rich in protein. Single cell protein denotes dead and dried cells of microbes where each cell is like a source of protein. Chlorella, a type of algae is used as SCP
